Pre-Game Insights: Los Angeles Clippers come into the matchup against Toronto Raptors as winners of three games in a row.
The Clippers averaged 16.2 points off of turnovers, 12.6 second-chance points, and 36.3 bench points last season.
Toronto Raptors had a 25-57 overall record with an 11-30 record on the road last season.
The Raptors averaged 112.4 points per game last season, 16.3 from the free-throw line, and 34.5 from deep.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Injuries for the Clippers include Mo Bamba (day to day, knee), P.J. Tucker (day to day, personal), and Kawhi Leonard (out, knee).

Injuries for the Raptors include Garrett Temple (day to day, back), Kelly Olynyk (day to day, back), Bruce Brown (out, knee), Immanuel Quickley (day to day, pelvis), Ja'Kobe Walter (out, shoulder), and Scottie Barnes (out, eye).
